data.title: Congressional Directory for the 117th Congress (2021
data.text: Congressional Directory for the 117th Congress (2021-2022), October 2022. [Pages 16-19] [From the U.S. Government Publishing Office, www.gpo.gov] ARKANSAS (Population 2010, 2,915,918) SENATORS JOHN NICHOLS BOOZMAN, Republican, of Rogers, AR; born in Shreveport, LA, December 10, 1950; education: Southern College of Optometry, Memphis, TN, 1977; University of Arkansas, Fayetteville, AR; professional: doctor of optometry; business owner; rancher; religion: Southern Baptist; married: Cathy Boozman; children: three daughters; committees: ranking member, Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry; Appropriations; Environment and Public Works; Veterans' Affairs; elected to the 107th Congress by special election on November 7, 2001; reelected to the succeeding four Congresses; elected to the U.S. Senate on November 2, 2010; reelected to each succeeding Senate term. Office Listings https://boozman.senate.gov https://facebook.com/JohnBoozman https://twitter.com/JohnBoozman https://instagram.com/johnboozman https://youtube.com/user/BoozmanPressOffice 141 Hart Senate Office Building, Washington, DC 20510. (202) 224-4843 Chief of Staff.--Toni-Marie Higgins. Deputy Chief of Staff / Counsel.--Susan Olson. Legislative Director.--Mackensie McKernan. Communications Director.--Sara Lasure. Scheduler.--Holly Lewis. 106 West Main Street, Suite 104, El Dorado, AR 71730.. (870) 863-4641 1120 Garrison Avenue, Suite 2B, Fort Smith, AR 72901.. (479) 573-0189 Constituent Services Director.--Kathy Watson. 300 South Church Street, Suite 400, Jonesboro, AR (870) 268-6925 72401................................................. 1401 West Capitol Avenue, Suite 155, Little Rock, AR (501) 372-7153 72201................................................. 213 West Monroe, Suite N, Lowell, AR 72745............ (479) 725-0400 State Director.--Stacey McClure. 1001 Highway 62 East, Suite 11, Mountain Home, AR (870) 424-0129 72653................................................. 620 East 22nd Street, Suite 204, Stuttgart, AR 72160.. (870) 672-6941 * * * TOM COTTON, Republican, of Dardanelle, AR; born in Dardanelle, AR, May 13, 1977; education: graduated Dardanelle High School; B.A., magna cum laude, Harvard University, Cambridge, MA, 1999; J.D., Harvard University, 2002; professional: attorney; management consultant; military service: U.S. Army Infantry Officer, 2005-09; awards: Ranger Tab Recipient; Army Commendation Medal; Combat Infantryman Badge; Iraq Campaign Medal; Bronze Star Medal; committees: Armed Services; Judiciary; Joint Economic Committee; Select Committee on Intelligence; elected to the 113th Congress on November 6, 2012; elected to the U.S. Senate on November 4, 2014; reelected to the U.S. Senate on November 3, 2020. Office Listings https://cotton.senate.gov https://facebook.com/SenatorTomCotton https://twitter.com/SenTomCotton 326 Russell Senate Office Building, Washington, DC (202) 224-2353 20510................................................. Chief of Staff.--Doug Coutts. FAX: 228-0908 Legislative Director.--Edward ``Eddie'' Linczer. Communications Director.--Caroline Tabler. 1401 West Capitol Avenue, Suite 235, Little Rock, AR (501) 223-9081 72201................................................. State Director.--Vanessa Moody. 1108 South Old Missouri Road, Suite B, Springdale, AR (479) 751-0879 72764................................................. 300 South Church, Suite 338, Jonesboro, AR 72401...... (870) 933-6223 106 West Main Street, Suite 410, El Dorado, AR 71730.. (870) 864-8582 REPRESENTATIVES FIRST DISTRICT RICK CRAWFORD, Republican, of Jonesboro, AR; born on Homestead AFB, FL, January 22, 1966; education: graduated, Alvirne High School; B.A., agricultural business and economics, Arkansas State University, Jonesboro, AR, 1996; professional: bomb disposal technician, U.S. [[Page 17]] Army, 1985-89; professional rodeo announcer; news anchor, KAIT-TV Jonesboro; farm director, KFIN-FM; producer and anchor, Delta Farm Roundup TV Show; marketing manager, John Deere; owner and operator, Agwatch; member: National Association of Farm Broadcasting; 4-H Foundation Board of Arkansas; recipient of the NAFB Newscast Award, 2006 and 2008; married: Stacy; children: Will and Delaney; caucuses: Republican Study Committee; committees: Agriculture; Transportation and Infrastructure; Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence; elected to the 112th Congress on November 2, 2010; reelected to each succeeding Congress. Office Listings https://crawford.house.gov https://twitter.com/RepRickCrawford https://instagram.com/reprickcrawford 2422 Rayburn House Office Building, Washington, DC (202) 225-4076 20515................................................. Chief of Staff.--Jonah Shumate. Press Secretary.--Sara Robertson. Legislative Director.--Ashley Shelton. 112 South First Street, Cabot, AR 72023............... (501) 843-3043 2400 Highland Drive, Suite 300, Jonesboro, AR 72401... (870) 203-0540 1001 Highway 62 East, Suite 9, Mountain Home, AR 72653 (870) 424-2075 101 East Waterman Street, Dumas, AR 71639............. (870) 377-5571 Counties: Arkansas, Baxter, Chicot, Clay, Cleburne, Craighead, Crittenden, Cross, Desha, Fulton, Greene, Independence, Izard, Jackson, Jefferson (part), Lawrence, Lee, Lincoln, Lonoke, Mississippi, Monroe, Phillips, Poinsett, Prairie, Randolph, Saint Francis, Searcy, Sharp, Stone, and Woodruff. Population (2017), 722,287. FRENCH HILL, Republican, of Little Rock, AR; born in Little Rock, December 5, 1956; education: B.S., economics, magna cum laude, Vanderbilt University, Nashville, TN, 1979; professional: senior financial analyst, InterFirst Corporation, 1979-82; legislative assistant, assistant to the chairman, Subcommittee on Housing and Urban Development, the Honorable John Tower (R-TX), Senate Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs, 1982-84; director, Mason Best Company, 1984-89; Deputy Assistant Secretary (Corporate Finance), U.S. Department of the Treasury, 1989-91; Special Assistant to the President, Executive Office of the White House, 1991-93; executive officer, Regions West, 1993-99; chief executive officer, Delta Trust & Banking Corp., 1999-2014; serves on the Congressional Oversight Commission established by the CARES Act; religion: Roman Catholic; family: married, two children; caucuses: co-chair, Congressional Skilled American Workforce Caucus; vice co-chair, Congressional Historically Black Colleges and Universities (HBCU) Caucus; Congressional Air Force Caucus; Congressional Army Caucus; Congressional Battlefield Caucus; Congressional Bipartisan Congressional Arts Caucus; Congressional Boating Caucus; Congressional Caucus on Fitness; Congressional Caucus on Foster Youth; Congressional Caucus on India and Indian-Americans; Congressional Chicken Caucus; Congressional Congenital Heart Caucus; Congressional Diabetes Caucus; Congressional Dyslexia Caucus; Congressional French Caucus; Congressional Historic Preservation Caucus; Congressional House Republican Israel Caucus; Congressional House Small Brewers Caucus; Congressional Humanities Caucus; Congressional International Conservation Caucus; Congressional Israel Allies Caucus; Congressional Kidney Caucus; Congressional Missile Defense Caucus; Congressional National Guard and Reserve Components Caucus (NGRCC); Congressional Natural Gas Caucus; Congressional Prayer Caucus; Congressional Scouting Caucus; Congressional Solidarity Caucus; Congressional Sportsman's Caucus; Congressional STEAM Caucus; Congressional U.S.-Japan Caucus; Congressional Study Group on Japan; Congressional Wine Caucus; committees: Financial Services; elected to the 114th Congress on November 4, 2014; reelected to each succeeding Congress. Office Listings https://womack.house.gov https://twitter.com/repstevewomack https://instagram.com/repstevewomack 2412 Rayburn House Office Building, Washington, (202) 225-4301 DC 20515........................................
